January 17, 2007 as '''2nd Avenue''' | picture format = [[480i]] ([[Standard-definition television|SDTV]]) | slogan = '''The channel for the Urbanite''' | owner = [[Solar Entertainment Corporation]] | sister names = [[Diva Universal (Philippines)|Diva Universal]]

[[The Game Channel]] | web = [http://www.2ndavenue.com.ph/ www.2ndavenue.com.ph] | terr serv 1 = [[RJTV]] | terr chan 1 = UHF Channel 29
Metro Manila | cable serv 1 = [[SkyCable]] | cable chan 1 = Channel 19 | cable serv 2 = [[Global Destiny Cable]] | cable chan 2 = Channel 29 | cable serv 3 = [[Cable Star Iloilo]] | cable chan 3 = Channel 38 | cable serv 4 = [[Cablelink]] | cable chan 4 = Channel 58 | cable serv 5 = [[Parasat Cable TV]] | cable chan 5 = Channel 65 | cable serv 6 = Mountain View Satellite Corporation | cable chan 6 = Channel 40 | cable serv 7 = Available on most cable systems | cable chan 7 = Check Local Listings for channels | sat serv 1 = | sat chan 1 = }} '''2nd Avenue''' (formerly '''ETC 2nd Avenue''') is a Philippine cable television produced and founded by Solar Entertainment Corporation which also created its sister stations, [[Universal Channel (Philippines)|Universal Channel]], [[Talk TV (Philippines)|Talk TV]], [[Diva Universal (Philippines)|Diva Universal]], [[ETC (TV channel)|ETC]], [[Jack TV]], [[Basketball TV]], & [[Solar Sports]]. It carries a schedule of mostly newer broadcast and cable dramas and sitcoms imported from the [[United States]], along with [[infotainment]] programming from that country in the daytime hours. As of January 1, 2008, 2nd Avenue ceased to air over SkyCable. However, it is still available over RJTV 29 (Channel 19 on [[SkyCable]] and Channel 29 on [[Global Destiny Cable]]). Dream Satellite TV had stopped airing the channel effective February 2009..[http://showbizandstyle.inquirer.net/entertainment/entertainment/view_article.php?article_id=102946 C/S, ETC, 2nd Avenue on free TV - INQUIRER.net, Philippine News for Filipinos] 2nd Avenue returned on Dream Satellte TV on channel 21 effective May 1, 2009 but removed on October 2011. ==History== [[Image:ETC 2ndAvenue logo.jpg|thumb|left|100px|Logo prior used from December 15, 2005 to January 17, 2007.]] [[Image:2ndAvenuelogo.jpg|thumb|left|100px|Logo prior used from January 17, 2007 to January 17, 2011.]] 2nd Avenue (formerly ETC 2nd Avenue) is a [[general entertainment]] [[Television network|channel]] in the [[Philippines]], owned by [[Solar Entertainment Corporation]]. ETC 2nd Avenue launched December 15, 2005 and started test broadcasts. ===Move to free TV=== On the first day of 2008, 2nd Avenue made its debut on [[DZRJ-TV|RJTV 29]] and selected cities nationwide. However at certain times of the week, RJTV pre-empts some 2nd Avenue shows to air its own shows.[http://showbizandstyle.inquirer.net/entertainment/entertainment/view_article.php?article_id=102946 C/S, ETC, 2nd Avenue on free TV - INQUIRER.net, Philippine News for Filipinos] A new on-air look and new shows has been announced by 2nd Avenue and will be done on March 21, 2008. ==Slogans== * Everybody's Watching (2006â2007) * You're on ETC 2nd Avenue! (2005â2006) * Entertainment Without Borders (2007) * Urban Entertainment (2007) * New Neighbors. New Destination. Same Avenue. (2008) * Redefined Entertainment. (2008) * We make TV worth watching. (2008) * You're on 2nd Avenue! (2008) * The channel for today's Urbanite (2011âpresent) ==Primetime Schedule== 2nd Avenue Programs offers dramas, general news & information, game shows, lifestyle, entertainment news, talk shows, sitcoms, and reality shows. Most of its shows are broadcasted from the 2nd Avenue's Solar Entertainment Corporation over Rajah Broadcasting Network inc. (RJTV 29). ==Programming== ===Local Shows on RJTV=== * ''RJ Sunday Jam'' (simulcast on [[DZRJ-FM|RJ 100.3]]) * ''Thank God it's RJ'' * ''Home Shopping Network'' * ''The RJ Show'' ===Current Shows=== ====Talk Shows==== * ''[[The Ellen DeGeneres Show]]'' * ''[[The Oprah Winfrey Show]]'' ====Reality Series==== * ''Double Exposure'' * ''Dress My Nest'' * ''[[Hell's Kitchen (US TV series)|Hell's Kitchen]]'' * ''Million Dollar Decorators'' * ''[[Top Chef]]'' * ''[[Top Chef: Just Desserts]]'' ====Comedy Series==== * ''[[Better with You]]'' * ''[[Doogie Howser, M.D.]]'' * ''[[How I Met Your Mother]]'' * ''[[Malcolm in the Middle]]'' * ''[[Modern Family]]'' * ''[[Outsourced (TV series)|Outsourced]]'' * ''[[Small Wonder (TV series)|Small Wonder]]'' * ''[[Still Standing (TV series)|Still Standing]]'' * ''[[The Wonder Years]]'' ====Drama Series==== * ''[[Hart of Dixie]]'' * ''[[House (TV series)|House]]'' * ''[[Love Bites (TV series)|Love Bites]]'' * ''[[The Mentalist]]'' * ''[[Parenthood (2010 TV series)|Parenthood]]'' * ''[[Royal Pains]]'' * ''[[The Tudors]]'' ====Entertainment News==== * ''[[Entertainment Tonight]]'' * ''[[Inside Edition]] '' ====Movie Block==== * The Screening Room ====Local Show==== * ''Two Stops Over'' ===Upcoming shows=== * ''[[Are You There, Chelsea?]]'' * ''[[I Hate My Teenage Daughter]]'' * ''[[Smash (TV series)|Smash]]'' ===Former shows=== ====All Shows==== * [http://www.bravotv.com/9-by-design ''9 By Design''] * ''[[30 Days (TV series)|30 Days]]'' * ''[[Ally McBeal]]'' * ''[[America's Got Talent]]'' * ''[[Back to You]]'' * ''[[Big Shots (TV series)|Big Shots]]'' * ''[[The Biggest Loser (U.S. TV series)|The Biggest Loser]]'' * ''[[Britain's Biggest Loser|The Biggest Loser (UK)]]'' * ''[[Blow Out]]'' * ''[[Celebrity Cooking Showdown]]'' * ''[[Chef Academy]]'' * ''[[Dateline NBC]]'' â  * ''[[Dharma & Greg]]'' * ''[[Dinner: Impossible]]'' * ''The Directors'' * ''[[Dr. 90210]]'' * ''[[Dr. Phil (TV series)|Dr. Phil]]'' * ''[[E!
